Posts.Content: Hi all, this is about the 6th time I have tried to post and just not having any luck!II I had my mastectomy 11 weeks ago (after having a lumpectomy in April which found a further 4 cancers). I have had 5 sessions of radiotherapy, but am now really worrying about a lump at the inner side of the scar which I thought was a seroma, but it seems quite hard. I have another lump under the arm which is a seroma and has been drained once since my op. Has anyone else had 'hard' lumps? Many thanks. x
Posts.Title: Mastectomy Scar

Posts.Content: Hi Sasch Rose No, I went last week and was given a gown that zipped up the front, but had velcro shoulders so they just peeled it off as I lay on the treatment area.  Afterwards they told me to take it home with me and bring it in each time I came for treatment.  The tats they gave me were so small I cannot see them! When do you start your actual treatment? xx
Posts.Title: Is RADS always like this?

Posts.Content: I think they said I could have the tattoos removed at a later date, but mine are literally so small  even smaller than a freckle.  They also told me to lock my dressing room door from the inside so.  There were 3 members of staff all female and were very pleasant.  I too agree that it is not on to make you walk through half naked!!!!
Posts.Title: Is RADS always like this?

Posts.Content: Hi, just wondered if anyone else was still getting side affects after being on them for 2 years.  Infact the pain and stiffness in my knees seems to be getting worse (although I do have arthritis).  I also have tingling/pins and needles in my hands which is not getting any better.  Sorry to be such a moan!!
Posts.Title: Another query re Letrozole

Posts.Content: Going by your user-name I'm guessing you are from Newcastle (or near).  I had my surgery in the RVI 19 months ago.  Your Mam will have been allocated a breast cancer nurse and they can be contacted during the day Monday to Friday (if they are not available at the time a message can be left and they will call back).  They are all really lovely.  Wishing your mum good luck with the surgery - she will be fine.  PatEnter your message...
Posts.Title: Feel like we've been left in limbo :(

Posts.Content: Hi Maggie, I stopped on 19 January, but I went through the Smoking Cessation Clinic at my doctors surgery.  I have a little plastic ciggie which has a very small  nicotine insert (I sometimes even use it without the nicotine just so I have something in my hand!!).  I have gave in to temptation only once which was last Thursday when I found out my daughter aged 42 now has breast cancer Pat
Posts.Title: smoking! !
